page.title: 17A Family Remembers (M)
page.content: People interviewed were: Mark Doggett aged 10, his grandmother and his great-grandmother age 91. Both Mark's nana and great-nana like living in Lancaster because of the interesting buildings. His grandma dislikes the waste and the litter. His great-grandma dislikes the weather. The greatest change they have seen is in the landscape. When they were young there were fields where now there are houses and offices. Mark's nana said that when she was young she used to have a bath in a tub in front of the fire. Instead of an electric blanket or hot-water bottle, they had a pan with hot coals in it which they put in the bed. Mark goes to school every day. In his spare time he plays with his friends and with his computer.
